   35:          end_per_group/2,

   38:         ]).

   77:          no_sensitive_leak/1,
   78:          ptty_alloc/1,
   79:          ptty_alloc_default/1,
   80:          ptty_alloc_pixel/1,
   81:          read_write_loop/1,
   82:          read_write_loop1/2,
   83:          send_after_exit/1,
   84:          simple_eval/1,
   85:          simple_exec/1,
   86:          simple_exec_sock/1,
   87:          simple_exec_two_socks/1,
   88:          small_cat/1,
   89:          small_interrupted_send/1,
   90:          start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write/1,
   91:          start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write_advanced/1,
   92:          start_shell/1,
   93:          new_shell_dumb_term/1,
   94:          new_shell_xterm_term/1,
   95:          start_shell_pty/1,

   98:          start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error/1,
   99:          start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error_type/1,
  100:          start_shell_exec_direct_fun2/1,
  101:          start_shell_exec_direct_fun3/1,
  102:          start_shell_exec_fun/1,
  103:          start_shell_exec_fun2/1,
  104:          start_shell_exec_fun3/1,
  105:          start_shell_sock_daemon_exec/1,

  107:          start_shell_sock_exec_fun/1,

  109:          stop_listener/1,
  110:          ssh_exec_echo/2 % called as an MFA
  111:         ]).
  112: 
  113: -define(EXEC_TIMEOUT, 10000).
  114: 
  115: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  116: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
  117: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  118: 
  119: %% suite() ->
  120: %%     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
  121: 
  122: suite() ->
  123:     [{timetrap,{seconds,40}}].
  124: 
  125: all() ->
  126:     [
  127: trap_exit_connect,
  128: trap_exit_daemon,
  129:      {group, openssh},
  130:      small_interrupted_send,
  131:      interrupted_send,
  132:      exec_erlang_term,
  133:      exec_erlang_term_non_default_shell,
  134:      exec_disabled,
  135:      exec_shell_disabled,
  136:      start_shell,
  137:      new_shell_dumb_term,
  138:      new_shell_xterm_term,
  139:      start_shell_pty,
  140:      start_shell_exec,
  141:      start_shell_exec_fun,
  142:      start_shell_exec_fun2,
  143:      start_shell_exec_fun3,
  144:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun,
  145:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun2,
  146:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun3,
  147:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error,
  148:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error_type,
  149:      start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write,
  150:      start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write_advanced,
  151:      start_shell_sock_exec_fun,
  152:      start_shell_sock_daemon_exec,
  153:      start_shell_sock_daemon_exec_multi,
  154:      encode_decode_pty_opts,
  155:      connect_sock_not_tcp,
  156:      connect2_invalid_options,
  157:      connect_invalid_port,
  158:      connect_invalid_options,
  159:      connect_invalid_timeout_0,
  160:      connect_invalid_timeout_1,
  161:      connect3_invalid_port,
  162:      connect3_invalid_options,
  163:      connect3_invalid_timeout_0,
  164:      connect3_invalid_timeout_1,
  165:      connect3_invalid_both,
  166:      connect4_invalid_two_0,
  167:      connect4_invalid_two_1,
  168:      connect4_invalid_two_2,
  169:      connect4_invalid_three,
  170:      connect_timeout,
  171:      daemon_sock_not_tcp,
  172:      gracefull_invalid_version,
  173:      gracefull_invalid_start,
  174:      gracefull_invalid_long_start,
  175:      gracefull_invalid_long_start_no_nl,
  176:      kex_error,
  177:      stop_listener,
  178:      no_sensitive_leak,
  179:      start_subsystem_on_closed_channel,
  180:      max_channels_option
  181:     ].
  182: groups() ->
  183:     [{openssh, [], payload() ++ ptty() ++ sock()}].
  184: 
  185: payload() ->
  186:     [simple_exec,
  187:      simple_exec_sock,
  188:      simple_exec_two_socks,
  189:      small_cat,
  190:      big_cat,
  191:      send_after_exit].
  192: 
  193: ptty() ->
  194:     [ptty_alloc_default,
  195:      ptty_alloc,
  196:      ptty_alloc_pixel].
  197: 
  198: sock() ->
  199:     [connect_sock_not_passive,
  200:      daemon_sock_not_passive
  201:     ].
  202: 
  203: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  204: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  205:     ?CHECK_CRYPTO(
  206:        [{ptty_supported, ssh_test_lib:ptty_supported()}
  207:         | Config]
  208:       ).
  209: 
  210: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  211:     catch ssh:stop(),
  212:     ok.
  213: 
  214: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  215: init_per_group(openssh, Config) ->
  216:     case ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []) of
  217: 	{error,econnrefused} ->
  218: 	    {skip,"No openssh daemon (econnrefused)"};
  219: 	{ok, Socket} ->
  220: 	    gen_tcp:close(Socket),
  221: 	    ssh_test_lib:openssh_sanity_check(Config)
  222:     end;
  223: init_per_group(_, Config) ->
  224:     Config.
  225: 
  226: end_per_group(_, Config) ->
  227:     Config.
  228: 
  229: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  230: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  231:     %% To make sure we start clean as it is not certain that
  232:     %% end_per_testcase will be run!
  233:     end_per_testcase(any, Config),
  234:     ssh:start(),
  235:     ssh_test_lib:verify_sanity_check(Config).
  236: 
  237: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, _Config) ->
  238:     ssh:stop().
  239: 
  240: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  241: %% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  242: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  243: simple_exec(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  244:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  245:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef).
  246: 
  247: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  248: simple_exec_sock(_Config) ->
  249:     {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{active,false}]),
  250:     {ok, ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  251:                                              {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  252:                                              {user_interaction, true}
  253:                                             ]),
  254:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef).
  255: 
  256: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  257: simple_exec_two_socks(_Config) ->
  258:     Parent = self(),
  259:     F = fun() ->
  260:                 spawn_link(
  261:                   fun() ->
  262:                           {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{active,false}]),
  263:                           {ok, ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  264:                                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  265:                                                                    {user_interaction, true}]),
  266:                           Parent ! {self(),do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef)}
  267:                   end)
  268:         end,
  269:     Pid1 = F(),
  270:     Pid2 = F(),
  271:     receive
  272:         {Pid1,ok} -> ok
  273:     end,
  274:     receive
  275:         {Pid2,ok} -> ok
  276:     end.
  277: 
  278: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  279: connect2_invalid_options(_Config) ->
  280:     {error, invalid_options} = ssh:connect(bogus_socket, {bad, option}).
  281: 
  282: connect3_invalid_port(_Config) ->
  283:     {error, invalid_port} = ssh:connect(bogus_host, noport, [{key, value}]).
  284: 
  285: connect3_invalid_options(_Config) ->
  286:     {error, invalid_options} = ssh:connect(bogus_host, 1337, bad_options).
  287: 
  288: connect3_invalid_timeout_0(_Config) ->
  289:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  290:         ssh:connect(bogus_socket, [{key, value}], short).
  291: 
  292: connect3_invalid_timeout_1(_Config) ->
  293:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  294:         ssh:connect(bogus_socket, [{key, value}], -1).
  295: 
  296: connect3_invalid_both(_Config) ->
  297:     %% The actual reason is implementation dependent.
  298:     {error, _Reason} =
  299:         ssh:connect(bogus, no_list_or_port, no_list_or_timeout).
  300: 
  301: connect_invalid_port(Config) ->
  302:     {Pid, Host, _Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  303: 
  304:     {error, invalid_port} =
  305:         ssh:connect(Host, undefined,
  306:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  307:                      {user, "foo"},
  308:                      {password, "morot"},
  309:                      {user_interaction, false},
  310:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  311:                     infinity),
  312: 
  313:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  314: 
  315: connect_invalid_timeout_0(Config) ->
  316:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  317: 
  318:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  319:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  320:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  321:                      {user, "foo"},
  322:                      {password, "morot"},
  323:                      {user_interaction, false},
  324:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  325:                    longer),
  326: 
  327:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  328: 
  329: connect_invalid_timeout_1(Config) ->
  330:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  331: 
  332:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  333:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  334:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  335:                      {user, "foo"},
  336:                      {password, "morot"},
  337:                      {user_interaction, false},
  338:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  339:                    -1),
  340: 
  341:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  342: 
  343: connect_invalid_options(Config) ->
  344:     {Pid, Host, Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  345: 
  346:     {error, invalid_options} =
  347:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  348:                     {user, "foo"},
  349:                     infinity),
  350: 
  351:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  352: 
  353: %% Two out three arguments incorrect.  Three possibilities.
  354: connect4_invalid_two_0(Config) ->
  355:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  356: 
  357:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  358:     {error, _} =
  359:         ssh:connect(Host, noport,
  360:                     {user, "foo"},
  361:                     infinity),
  362: 
  363:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  364: 
  365: connect4_invalid_two_1(Config) ->
  366:     {Pid, Host, Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  367: 
  368:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  369:     {error, _} =
  370:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  371:                     {user, "foo"},
  372:                     short),
  373: 
  374:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  375: 
  376: connect4_invalid_two_2(Config) ->
  377:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  378: 
  379:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  380:     {error, _} =
  381:         ssh:connect(Host, newport,
  382:                     [{user, "foo"}],
  383:                     -1),
  384: 
  385:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  386: 
  387: %% All three args incorrect
  388: connect4_invalid_three(Config) ->
  389:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  390: 
  391:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  392:     {error, _} =
  393:         ssh:connect(Host, teleport,
  394:                     {user, "foo"},
  395:                     fortnight),
  396: 
  397:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  398: 
  399: daemon_start(Config) ->
  400:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  401:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  402:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  403:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  404: 
  405:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  406:                                              {user_dir, UserDir},
  407:                                              {password, "morot"},
  408:                                              {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
  409:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir}.
  410: 
  411: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  412: connect_sock_not_tcp(_Config) ->
  413:     {ok,Sock} = gen_udp:open(0, []), 
  414:     {error, not_tcp_socket} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  415:                                                  {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  416:                                                  {user_interaction, true}]),
  417:     gen_udp:close(Sock).
  418: 
  419: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  420: connect_timeout(_Config) ->
  421:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, []),
  422:     {ok, {_,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),
  423:     {error,timeout} = ssh:connect(loopback, Port, [{connect_timeout,2000},
  424:                                                    {save_accepted_host, false},
  425:                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true}]),
  426:     gen_tcp:close(Sl).
  427: 
  428: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  429: daemon_sock_not_tcp(_Config) ->
  430:     {ok,Sock} = gen_udp:open(0, []), 
  431:     {error, not_tcp_socket} = ssh:daemon(Sock),
  432:     gen_udp:close(Sock).
  433: 
  434: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  435: connect_sock_not_passive(_Config) ->
  436:     {ok,Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []), 
  437:     {error, not_passive_mode} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  438:                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  439:                                                    {user_interaction, true}]),
  440:     gen_tcp:close(Sock).
  441: 
  442: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  443: daemon_sock_not_passive(_Config) ->
  444:     {ok,Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []), 
  445:     {error, not_passive_mode} = ssh:daemon(Sock),
  446:     gen_tcp:close(Sock).
  447: 
  448: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  449: small_cat(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  450:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  451:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  452:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  453: 				  "cat", infinity),
  454: 
  455:     Data = <<"I like spaghetti squash">>,
  456:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data),
  457:     ok = ssh_connection:send_eof(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0),
  458: 
  459:     %% receive response to input
  460:     receive
  461: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, Data}} ->
  462: 	    ok
  463:     after 
  464: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  465:     end,
  466: 
  467:     %% receive close messages
  468:     receive
  469: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
  470: 	    ok
  471:     after 
  472: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  473:     end,
  474:     receive
  475: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
  476: 	    ok
  477:     after 
  478: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  479:     end,
  480:     receive
  481: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  482: 	    ok
  483:     after 
  484: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  485:     end.
  486: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  487: big_cat(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  488:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  489: 							     {user_interaction, false}]),
  490:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  491:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  492: 				  "cat", infinity),
  493: 
  494:     %% build 10MB binary
  495:     Data = << <<X:32>> || X <- lists:seq(1,2500000)>>,
  496: 
  497:     %% pre-adjust receive window so the other end doesn't block
  498:     ssh_connection:adjust_window(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, size(Data)),
  499: 
  500:     ct:log("sending ~p byte binary~n",[size(Data)]),
  501:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data, 10000),
  502:     ok = ssh_connection:send_eof(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0),
  503: 
  504:     %% collect echoed data until eof
  505:     case big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0) of
  506: 	{ok, Data} ->
  507: 	    ok;
  508: 	{ok, Other} ->
  509: 	    case size(Data) =:= size(Other) of
  510: 		true ->
  511: 		    ct:log("received and sent data are same"
  512: 			   "size but do not match~n",[]);
  513: 		false ->
  514: 		    ct:log("sent ~p but only received ~p~n",
  515: 			   [size(Data), size(Other)])
  516: 	    end,
  517: 	    ct:fail(receive_data_mismatch);
  518: 	Else ->
  519: 	    ct:fail(Else)
  520:     end,
  521: 
  522:     %% receive close messages (eof already consumed)
  523:     receive
  524: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
  525: 	    ok 
  526:     after 
  527: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  528:     end,
  529:     receive
  530: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  531: 	    ok
  532:     after 
  533: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  534:     end.
  535: 
  536: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  537: send_after_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  538:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  539:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  540:     Data = <<"I like spaghetti squash">>,
  541: 
  542:     %% Shell command "false" will exit immediately
  543:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  544: 				  "false", infinity),
  545:     receive
  546: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
  547: 	    ok
  548:     after 
  549: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  550:     end,
  551:     receive
  552: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, ExitStatus}} when ExitStatus=/=0 ->
  553: 	    ok
  554:     after 
  555: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  556:     end,
  557:     receive
  558: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  559: 	    ok
  560:     after 
  561: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  562:     end,
  563:     case ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data, 2000) of
  564: 	{error, closed} -> ok;
  565: 	ok ->
  566: 	    ct:fail({expected,{error,closed}, {got, ok}});
  567: 	{error, timeout} ->
  568: 	    ct:fail({expected,{error,closed}, {got, {error, timeout}}});
  569: 	Else ->
  570: 	    ct:fail(Else)
  571:     end.
  572: 
  573: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  574: encode_decode_pty_opts(_Config) ->
  575:     Tags =
  576:         [vintr, vquit, verase, vkill, veof, veol, veol2, vstart, vstop, vsusp, vdsusp,
  577:          vreprint, vwerase, vlnext, vflush, vswtch, vstatus, vdiscard, ignpar, parmrk,
  578:          inpck, istrip, inlcr, igncr, icrnl, iuclc, ixon, ixany, ixoff, imaxbel, isig,
  579:          icanon, xcase, echo, echoe, echok, echonl, noflsh, tostop, iexten, echoctl,
  580:          echoke, pendin, opost, olcuc, onlcr, ocrnl, onocr, onlret, cs7, cs8, parenb,
  581:          parodd, tty_op_ispeed, tty_op_ospeed],
  582:     Opts =
  583:         lists:zip(Tags,
  584:                   lists:seq(1, length(Tags))),
  585:     
  586:     case ssh_connection:encode_pty_opts(Opts) of
  587:         Bin when is_binary(Bin) ->
  588:             case ssh_connection:decode_pty_opts(Bin) of
  589:                 Opts ->
  590:                     ok;
  591:                 Other ->
  592:                     ct:log("Expected ~p~nGot ~p~nBin = ~p",[Opts,Other,Bin]),
  593:                     ct:fail("Not the same",[])
  594:             end;
  595:         Other ->
  596:             ct:log("encode -> ~p",[Other]),
  597:             ct:fail("Encode failed",[])
  598:     end.
  599: 
  600: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  601: ptty_alloc_default(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  602:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  603:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  604:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  605:                  true -> success;
  606:                  false -> failure
  607:              end,
  608:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, []),
  609:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  610: 
  611: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  612: ptty_alloc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  613:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  614:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  615:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  616:                  true -> success;
  617:                  false -> failure
  618:              end,
  619:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, 
  620:                                        [{term, os:getenv("TERM", ?DEFAULT_TERMINAL)}, {width, 70}, {height, 20}]),
  621:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  622: 
  623: 
  624: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  625: ptty_alloc_pixel(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  626:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  627:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  628:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  629:                  true -> success;
  630:                  false -> failure
  631:              end,
  632:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, 
  633:                                        [{term, os:getenv("TERM", ?DEFAULT_TERMINAL)}, {pixel_widh, 630}, {pixel_hight, 470}]),
  634:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  635: 
  636: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  637: small_interrupted_send(Config) -> 
  638:     K = 1024,
  639:     M = K*K,
  640:     do_interrupted_send(Config, 10*M, 4*K).
  641: interrupted_send(Config) ->
  642:     M = 1024*1024,
  643:     do_interrupted_send(Config, 10*M, 4*M).
  644: 
  645: do_interrupted_send(Config, SendSize, EchoSize) ->
  646:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  647:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  648:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  649:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  650:     EchoSS_spec = {ssh_echo_server, [EchoSize,[{dbg,true}]]},
  651:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  652: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  653: 					     {password, "morot"},
  654: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n",EchoSS_spec}]}]),
  655:     
  656:     ct:log("~p:~p connect", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  657:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  658: 						      {user, "foo"},
  659: 						      {password, "morot"},
  660: 						      {user_interaction, false},
  661: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  662:     ct:log("~p:~p connected", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  663: 
  664:     %% build big binary
  665:     Data = << <<X:32>> || X <- lists:seq(1,SendSize div 4)>>,
  666: 
  667:     %% expect remote end to send us EchoSize back
  668:     <<ExpectedData:EchoSize/binary, _/binary>> = Data,
  669: 
  670:     %% Spawn listener. Otherwise we could get a deadlock due to filled buffers
  671:     Parent = self(),
  672:     ResultPid = spawn(
  673: 		  fun() ->
  674: 			  ct:log("~p:~p open channel",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
  675: 			  {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  676: 			  ct:log("~p:~p start subsystem", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  677: 			  case ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, "echo_n", infinity) of
  678: 			      success ->
  679: 				  Parent ! {self(), channelId, ChannelId},
  680: 				  
  681: 				  Result = 
  682: 				      try collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize)
  683: 				      of
  684: 					  ExpectedData -> 
  685: 					      ct:log("~p:~p got expected data",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
  686: 					      ok;
  687: 					  Other ->
  688: 					      ct:log("~p:~p unexpected: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Other]),
  689: 					      {fail,"unexpected result in listener"}
  690: 				      catch
  691: 					  Class:Exception ->
  692: 					      {fail, io_lib:format("Listener exception ~p:~p",[Class,Exception])}
  693: 				      end,
  694: 				  Parent ! {self(), result, Result};
  695: 			      Other ->
  696: 				  Parent ! {self(), channelId, error, Other}
  697: 			  end
  698: 		  end),
  699:     
  700:     receive
  701: 	{ResultPid, channelId, error, Other} ->
  702: 	    ct:log("~p:~p channelId error ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Other]),
  703: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  704: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  705: 	    {fail, "ssh_connection:subsystem"};
  706: 
  707: 	{ResultPid, channelId, ChannelId} ->
  708: 	    ct:log("~p:~p ~p going to send ~p bytes", [?MODULE,?LINE,self(),size(Data)]),
  709: 	    SenderPid = spawn(fun() ->
  710: 				      Parent ! {self(),  ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Data, 30000)}
  711: 			      end),
  712: 	    receive
  713: 	    	{ResultPid, result, {fail, Fail}} ->
  714: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Listener failed: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Fail]),
  715: 		    {fail, Fail};
  716: 
  717: 		{ResultPid, result, Result} ->
  718: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Got result: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Result]),
  719: 		    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  720: 		    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  721: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Check sender", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  722: 		    receive
  723: 			{SenderPid, {error, closed}} ->
  724: 			    ct:log("~p:~p {error,closed} - That's what we expect :)",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
  725: 			    ok;
  726: 			Msg ->
  727: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Not expected send result: ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  728: 			    {fail, "Not expected msg"}
  729: 		    end;
  730: 
  731: 		{SenderPid, {error, closed}} ->
  732: 		    ct:log("~p:~p {error,closed} - That's what we expect, but client channel handler has not reported yet",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
  733: 		    receive
  734: 			{ResultPid, result, Result} ->
  735: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Now got the result: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Result]),
  736: 			    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  737: 			    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  738: 			    ok;
  739: 			Msg ->
  740: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Got an unexpected msg ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  741: 			    {fail, "Un-expected msg"}
  742: 		    end;
  743: 
  744: 		Msg ->
  745: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  746: 		    {fail, "Unexpected msg"}
  747: 	    end
  748:     end.
  749: 
  750: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  751: start_shell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  752:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  753:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  754:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  755:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  756:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  757: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  758: 					     {password, "morot"},
  759: 					     {shell, fun(U, H) -> start_our_shell(U, H) end} ]),
  760: 
  761:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  762: 						      {user, "foo"},
  763: 						      {password, "morot"},
  764: 						      {user_interaction, true},
  765: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  766:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Enter command">>), % No pty alloc by erl client
  767:     test_exec_is_disabled(ConnectionRef),
  768:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  769:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  770: 
  771: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  772: new_shell_dumb_term(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  773:     new_shell_helper(#{term => "dumb",
  774:                        cmds => ["one_atom_please.\n",
  775:                                 "\^R" % attempt to trigger history search
  776:                                ],
  777:                        exp_output =>
  778:                            [<<"Enter command\r\n">>,
  779:                             <<"1> ">>,
  780:                             <<"one_atom_please.\r\n">>,
  781:                             <<"{simple_eval,one_atom_please}\r\n">>,
  782:                             <<"2> ">>],
  783:                        unexp_output =>
  784:                            [<<"\e[;1;4msearch:\e[0m ">>]},
  785:                     Config).
  786: 
  787: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  788: new_shell_xterm_term(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  789:     new_shell_helper(#{term => "xterm",
  790:                        cmds => ["one_atom_please.\n",
  791:                                 "\^R" % attempt to trigger history search
  792:                                ],
  793:                        exp_output =>
  794:                            [<<"Enter command\r\n">>,
  795:                             <<"1> ">>,
  796:                             <<"one_atom_please.\r\n\e[1022D\e[1B">>,
  797:                             <<"{simple_eval,one_atom_please}\r\n">>,
  798:                             <<"2> ">>,
  799:                             <<"\e[3D\e[J">>,
  800:                             <<"\e[;1;4msearch:\e[0m ">>,
  801:                             <<"\r\n  one_atom_please.">>]},
  802:                     Config).
  803: 
  804: new_shell_helper(#{term := Term, cmds := Cmds,
  805:                    exp_output := ExpectedOutput} = Settings, Config) ->
  806:     UnexpectedOutput = maps:get(unexp_output, Settings, []),
  807:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  808:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  809:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  810:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  811:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  812: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  813: 					     {password, "morot"},
  814:                                              {subsystems, []},
  815:                                              {keepalive, true},
  816:                                              {nodelay, true},
  817:                                              {shell, fun(U, H) ->
  818:                                                              start_our_shell2(U, H)
  819:                                                      end}
  820:                                             ]),
  821:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  822: 						      {user, "foo"},
  823: 						      {password, "morot"},
  824: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  825:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  826:     success =
  827:         ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId,
  828:                                   [{term, Term}, {hight, 24}, {width,1023}],
  829:                                   infinity),
  830:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId),
  831:     [ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, C) || C <- Cmds],
  832:     GetTuple = fun(Bin) -> {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,0,Bin}} end,
  833:     Msgs = [GetTuple(B) || B <- ExpectedOutput],
  834:     expected = ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result(Msgs),
  835:     UnexpectedMsgs = [GetTuple(C) || C <- UnexpectedOutput],
  836:     flush_msgs(UnexpectedMsgs),
  837: 
  838:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  839:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  840: 
  841: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------

  846:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  847:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  848: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  849: 					     {password, "morot"},
  850: 					     {shell, fun(U, H) -> start_our_shell(U, H) end} ]),
  851: 
  852:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  853: 						      {user, "foo"},
  854: 						      {password, "morot"},
  855: 						      {user_interaction, true},
  856: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  857:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Enter command\r\n">>, [{pty_opts,[{onlcr,1}]}]), % alloc pty 
  858:     test_exec_is_disabled(ConnectionRef),

  970: start_shell_exec_fun(Config) ->
  971:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd) ->
  972:                                     spawn(fun() ->
  973:                                                   io:format("echo ~s\n", [Cmd])
  974:                                           end)
  975:                             end,
  976:                             "testing", <<"echo testing\n">>, 0,
  977:                             Config).
  978: 
  979: start_shell_exec_fun2(Config) ->
  980:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd, User) ->
  981:                                     spawn(fun() ->
  982:                                                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
  983:                                           end)
  984:                             end,
  985:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing\n">>, 0,
  986:                             Config).
  987: 
  988: start_shell_exec_fun3(Config) ->
  989:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd, User, _PeerAddr) ->
  990:                                     spawn(fun() ->
  991:                                                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
  992:                                           end)
  993:                             end,
  994:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing\n">>, 0,
  995:                             Config).
  996: 
  997: start_shell_exec_direct_fun(Config) ->
  998:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s~n",[Cmd])} end},
  999:                             "testing", <<"echo testing\n">>, 0,
 1000:                             Config).
 1001: 
 1002: start_shell_exec_direct_fun2(Config) ->
 1003:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd,User) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s ~s",[User,Cmd])} end},
 1004:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing">>, 0,
 1005:                             Config).
 1006: 
 1007: start_shell_exec_direct_fun3(Config) ->
 1008:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd,User,_PeerAddr) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s ~s",[User,Cmd])} end},
 1009:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing">>, 0,
 1010:                             Config).
 1011: 
 1012: start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error(Config) ->
 1013:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(_Cmd) -> {error, {bad}} end},
 1014:                             "testing", <<"**Error** {bad}">>, 1,
 1015:                             Config).
 1016: 
 1017: start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error_type(Config) ->
 1018:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(_Cmd) -> very_bad end},
 1019:                             "testing", <<"**Error** Bad exec fun in server. Invalid return value: very_bad">>, 1,
 1020:                             Config).
 1021: 
 1022: start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write(Config) ->
 1023:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1024:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1025:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1026:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1027:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1028: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1029: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1030: 					     {exec, {direct,fun read_write_loop/1}}]),
 1031: 
 1032:     C = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1033:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1034:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1035:                                           {user_interaction, true},
 1036:                                           {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1037: 
 1038:     {ok, Ch} = ssh_connection:session_channel(C, infinity),
 1039: 
 1040:     success = ssh_connection:exec(C, Ch, "> ", infinity),
 1041:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"Tiny read/write test\n">>}}),
 1042: 
 1043:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"1> ">>}}),
 1044:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "hej.\n", 5000),
 1045:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,hej}\n">>}}),
 1046: 
 1047:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"2> ">>}}),
 1048:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "quit.\n", 5000),
 1049:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{1,inputs}">>}}),
 1050:     receive
 1051:         {ssh_cm,C,{exit_status,Ch,0}} -> ok
 1052:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1053:     end,
 1054:     receive
 1055:         {ssh_cm,C,{eof,Ch}} -> ok
 1056:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1057:     end,
 1058:     receive
 1059:         {ssh_cm,C,{closed,Ch}} -> ok
 1060:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1061:     end,
 1062:     receive
 1063:         X -> ct:fail("remaining messages"),
 1064:              ct:log("remaining message: ~p",[X])
 1065:     after 0 -> go_on
 1066:     end,
 1067:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1068: 
 1069: 
 1070: start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write_advanced(Config) ->
 1071:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1072:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1073:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1074:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1075:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1076: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1077: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1078: 					     {exec, {direct,fun read_write_loop/1}}]),
 1079: 
 1080:     C = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1081:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1082:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1083:                                           {user_interaction, true},
 1084:                                           {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1085: 
 1086:     {ok, Ch} = ssh_connection:session_channel(C, infinity),
 1087: 
 1088:     success = ssh_connection:exec(C, Ch, "> ", infinity),
 1089:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"Tiny read/write test\n">>}}),
 1090: 
 1091:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"1> ">>}}),
 1092:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "hej.\n", 5000),
 1093:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,hej}\n">>}}),
 1094: 
 1095:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"2> ">>}}),
 1096:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "'Hi ", 5000),
 1097:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "there", 5000),
 1098:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "'", 5000),
 1099:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, ".\n", 5000),
 1100:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,'Hi there'}\n">>}}),
 1101:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"3> ">>}}),
 1102:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "bad_input.\n", 5000),
 1103:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,1,<<"**Error** {bad_input,3}">>}}),
 1104:     receive
 1105:         {ssh_cm,C,{exit_status,Ch,255}} -> ok
 1106:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1107:     end,
 1108:     receive
 1109:         {ssh_cm,C,{eof,Ch}} -> ok
 1110:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1111:     end,
 1112:     receive
 1113:         {ssh_cm,C,{closed,Ch}} -> ok
 1114:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1115:     end,
 1116:     receive
 1117:         X -> ct:fail("remaining messages"),
 1118:              ct:log("remaining message: ~p",[X])
 1119:     after 0 -> go_on
 1120:     end,
 1121:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1122: 
 1123: 
 1124: 
 1125:     
 1126: %% A tiny read-write loop ended by a 'quit.\n'
 1127: read_write_loop(Prompt) ->
 1128:     io:format("Tiny read/write test~n", []),
 1129:     read_write_loop1(Prompt, 1).
 1130: 
 1131: read_write_loop1(Prompt, N) ->
 1132:     case io:read(lists:concat([N,Prompt])) of
 1133:         {ok, quit} ->
 1134:             {ok, {N-1, inputs}};
 1135:         {ok, bad_input} ->
 1136:             {error, {bad_input,N}};
 1137:         {ok,Inp} ->
 1138:             io:format("~p~n",[simple_eval(Inp)]),
 1139:             read_write_loop1(Prompt, N+1)
 1140:     end.
 1141:     
 1142: simple_eval(Inp) -> {simple_eval,Inp}.
 1143: 
 1144: 
 1145: do_start_shell_exec_fun(Fun, Command, Expect, ExpectType, Config) ->
 1146:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1147:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1148:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1149:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1150:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1151: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1152: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1153: 					     {exec, Fun}]),
 1154: 
 1155:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1156: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1157: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1158: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1159: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1160: 
 1161:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1162: 
 1163:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Command, infinity),
 1164: 
 1165:     receive
 1166: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, ExpectType, Expect}} ->
 1167: 	    ok
 1168:     after 5000 ->
 1169:             receive
 1170:                 Other ->
 1171:                     ct:log("Received other:~n~p~nExpected: ~p~n",
 1172:                            [Other, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, '_ChannelId', ExpectType, Expect}} ]),
 1173:                     ct:fail("Unexpected response")
 1174:             after 0 ->
 1175:                     ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1176:             end
 1177:     end,
 1178: 
 1179:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1180:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1181:  
 1182: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1183: %% Issue #8223
 1184: trap_exit_connect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1185:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1186:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey),
 1187:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1188:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1189:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1190:                                              {user_dir, UserDir},
 1191:                                              {password, "morot"}]),
 1192:     %% Fake an EXIT message
 1193:     ExitMsg = {'EXIT', self(), make_ref()},
 1194:     self() ! ExitMsg,
 1195: 
 1196:     {ok, ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1197:                                                    {save_accepted_host, false},
 1198:                                                    {user, "foo"},
 1199:                                                    {password, "morot"},
 1200:                                                    {user_interaction, true},
 1201:                                                    {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1202:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1203:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
 1204: 
 1205:     %% Ensure the EXIT message is still there
 1206:     receive
 1207:         ExitMsg -> ok
 1208:     after 0 ->
 1209:         ct:fail("No EXIT message")
 1210:     end.
 1211:

 1213: %% Issue #8223
 1214: trap_exit_daemon(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1215:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1216:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey),
 1217:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1218:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1219: 
 1220:     %% Fake an EXIT message
 1221:     ExitMsg = {'EXIT', self(), make_ref()},
 1222:     self() ! ExitMsg,
 1223: 
 1224:     {ok, DaemonRef} = ssh:daemon(0, [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1225:                                      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1226:     ssh:stop_daemon(DaemonRef),
 1227: 
 1228:     %% Ensure the EXIT message is still there
 1229:     receive
 1230:         ExitMsg -> ok
 1231:     after 0 ->
 1232:         ct:fail("No EXIT message")
 1233:     end.

 1235: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1236: start_shell_sock_exec_fun(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1237:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1238:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1239:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1240:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1241:     {Pid, HostD, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1242:                                               {user_dir, UserDir},
 1243:                                               {password, "morot"},
 1244:                                               {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1245:     Host = ssh_test_lib:ntoa(ssh_test_lib:mangle_connect_address(HostD)),
 1246: 
 1247:     {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, [{active,false}]),
 1248:     {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1249:                                             {save_accepted_host, false},
 1250: 					    {user, "foo"},
 1251: 					    {password, "morot"},
 1252: 					    {user_interaction, true},
 1253: 					    {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1254: 
 1255:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1256: 
 1257:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 1258: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1259: 
 1260:     receive
 1261: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1262: 	    ok
 1263:     after 5000 ->
 1264: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1265:     end,
 1266: 
 1267:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1268:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1269: 
 1270: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1271: start_shell_sock_daemon_exec(Config) ->
 1272:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1273:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1274:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1275:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1276: 
 1277:     %% Listening tcp socket at the client side
 1278:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active,false}]),
 1279:     {ok,{_IP,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),	% _IP is likely to be {0,0,0,0}. Win don't like...
 1280: 
 1281:     %% A server tcp-contects to the listening socket and starts an ssh daemon
 1282:     spawn_link(fun() ->
 1283: 		       {ok,Ss} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Port, [{active,false}]),
 1284: 		       {ok, _Pid} = ssh:daemon(Ss, [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1285: 						    {user_dir, UserDir},
 1286: 						    {password, "morot"},
 1287: 						    {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}])
 1288: 	       end),
 1289: 
 1290:     %% The client accepts the tcp connection from the server and ssh-connects to it
 1291:     {ok,Sc} = gen_tcp:accept(Sl),
 1292:     {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sc, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1293:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1294: 					  {user, "foo"},
 1295: 					  {password, "morot"},
 1296: 					  {user_interaction, true},
 1297: 					  {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1298: 
 1299:     %% And runs some commands
 1300:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1301: 
 1302:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 1303: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1304: 
 1305:     receive
 1306: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1307: 	    ok
 1308:     after 5000 ->
 1309: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1310:     end,
 1311: 
 1312:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
 1313: 
 1314: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1315: start_shell_sock_daemon_exec_multi(Config) ->
 1316:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1317:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1318:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1319:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1320: 
 1321:     NumConcurent = 5,
 1322: 
 1323:     %% Listening tcp socket at the client side
 1324:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active,false}]),
 1325:     {ok,{_IP,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),	% _IP is likely to be {0,0,0,0}. Win don't like...
 1326: 
 1327:     DaemonOpts = [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1328:                   {user_dir, UserDir},
 1329:                   {password, "morot"},
 1330:                   {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}],
 1331: 
 1332:     %% Servers tcp-contects to the listening socket and starts an ssh daemon
 1333:     Pids =
 1334:         [spawn_link(fun() ->
 1335:                             {ok,Ss} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Port, [{active,false}]),
 1336:                             {ok, _Pid} = ssh:daemon(Ss, DaemonOpts)
 1337:                     end)
 1338:          || _ <- lists:seq(1,NumConcurent)],
 1339:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p daemons spawned!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(Pids)]),
 1340: 
 1341:     %% The client accepts the tcp connections from the servers and ssh-connects to it
 1342:     ConnectionRefs =
 1343:         [begin
 1344:              {ok,Sc} = gen_tcp:accept(Sl),
 1345:              {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sc, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1346:                                                    {save_accepted_host, false},
 1347:                                                    {user, "foo"},
 1348:                                                    {password, "morot"},
 1349:                                                    {user_interaction, true},
 1350:                                                    {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1351:              ConnectionRef
 1352:          end || _Pid <- Pids],
 1353:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p connections accepted!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(ConnectionRefs)]),
 1354: 
 1355:     %% And runs some exec commands
 1356:     Parent = self(),
 1357:     ClientPids =
 1358:         lists:map(
 1359:           fun(ConnectionRef) ->
 1360:                   spawn_link(
 1361:                     fun() ->
 1362:                             {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1363:                             success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, "testing", infinity),
 1364:                             ct:log("~p:~p: exec on connection ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,ConnectionRef]),
 1365:                             receive
 1366:                                 {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1367:                                     Parent ! {answer_received,self()},
 1368:                                     ct:log("~p:~p: received result on connection ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,ConnectionRef])
 1369:                             after 5000 ->
 1370:                                     ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1371:                             end
 1372:                     end)
 1373:           end, ConnectionRefs),
 1374:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p clients spawned!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(ClientPids)]),
 1375: 
 1376:     lists:foreach(fun(P) ->
 1377:                           receive
 1378:                               {answer_received,P} -> ok
 1379:                           end
 1380:                   end, ClientPids),
 1381:     ct:log("~p:~p: All answers received!", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
 1382: 
 1383:     lists:foreach(fun ssh:close/1, ConnectionRefs).
 1384: 
 1385: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1386: gracefull_invalid_version(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1387:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1388:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1389:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1390:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1391:     
 1392:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1393:                                                {user_dir, UserDir},
 1394:                                                {password, "morot"}]),
 1395: 
 1396:     {ok, S} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, []),
 1397:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S,  ["SSH-8.-1","\r\n"]),
 1398:     receive
 1399: 	Verstring ->
 1400: 	    ct:log("Server version: ~p~n", [Verstring]),
 1401: 	    receive
 1402: 		{tcp_closed, S} ->
 1403: 		    ok
 1404: 	    end
 1405:     after 
 1406: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1407:     end.
 1408: 
 1409: gracefull_invalid_start(Config) when is_list(Config) ->

 1412:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1413:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1414:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1415:                                                {user_dir, UserDir},
 1416:                                                {password, "morot"}]),
 1417: 
 1418:     {ok, S} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, []),
 1419:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S,  ["foobar","\r\n"]),
 1420:     receive
 1421: 	Verstring ->
 1422: 	    ct:log("Server version: ~p~n", [Verstring]),

 1426: 	    end
