 1476: kex_error(Config) ->
 1477:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1478:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1479:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1480:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1481:     [Kex1,Kex2|_] = proplists:get_value(kex, ssh:default_algorithms()),
 1482:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1483:                                               {user_dir, UserDir},
 1484:                                               {password, "morot"},
 1485:                                               {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[Kex1]}]}
 1486:                                              ]),
 1487:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1488:     ok = ssh_log_h:add_fun(kex_error,
 1489:                            fun(#{msg:={report,#{format:=Fmt,args:=As,label:={error_logger,_}}}}, Pid) ->
 1490:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1491:                                    Pid ! {Ref, lists:flatten(io_lib:format(Fmt,As))};
 1492:                               (_,Pid) ->
 1493:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1494:                                    ok % Other msg
 1495:                            end,
 1496:                            self()),
 1497:     try
 1498:         ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1499:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1500:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1501:                                           {user_interaction, false},
 1502:                                           {user_dir, UserDir},
 1503:                                           {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[Kex2]}]}
 1504:                                          ])
 1505:     of
 1506:         _ ->
 1507:             ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1508:             ct:fail("expected failure", [])
 1509:     catch
 1510:         error:{badmatch,{error,"Key exchange failed"}} ->
 1511:             %% ok
 1512:             receive
 1513:                 {Ref, ErrMsgTxt} ->
 1514:                     ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1515:                     ct:log("ErrMsgTxt = ~n~s", [ErrMsgTxt]),
 1516:                     Lines = lists:map(fun string:trim/1, string:tokens(ErrMsgTxt, "\n")),
 1517:                     OK = (lists:all(fun(S) -> lists:member(S,Lines) end,
 1518:                                     ["Disconnects with code = 3 [RFC4253 11.1]: Key exchange failed",
 1519:                                      "Details:",
 1520:                                      "No common key exchange algorithm,",
 1521:                                      "we have:",
 1522:                                      "peer have:"]) andalso
 1523:                           string:find(ErrMsgTxt, atom_to_list(Kex1)) =/= nomatch andalso
 1524:                           string:find(ErrMsgTxt, atom_to_list(Kex2)) =/= nomatch),
 1525:                     case OK of
 1526:                         true ->
 1527:                             ok;
 1528:                         false ->
 1529:                             ct:fail("unexpected error text msg", [])
 1530:                     end
 1531:             after 20000 ->
 1532:                     ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1533:                     ct:fail("timeout", [])
 1534:             end;
 1535: 
 1536:         error:{badmatch,{error,_}} ->
 1537:             ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1538:             ct:fail("unexpected error msg", [])
 1539:     end.
 1540: 
 1541: stop_listener(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1542:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1543:     %% to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1544:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey),
 1545:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1546:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1547: 
 1548:     {Pid0, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1549: 					      {user_dir, UserDir},
 1550: 					      {password, "morot"},
 1551: 					      {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1552: 
 1553:     ConnectionRef0 = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port,
 1554:                                           [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1555:                                            {user, "foo"},
 1556:                                            {password, "morot"},
 1557:                                            {user_interaction, false},
 1558:                                            {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1559:     {ok, ChannelId0} =
 1560:         ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef0, infinity),
 1561: 
 1562:     ssh:stop_listener(Host, Port),
 1563: 
 1564:     {error, _} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1565:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1566:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1567: 					  {user, "foo"},
 1568: 					  {password, "morot"},
 1569: 					  {user_interaction, true},
 1570: 					  {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1571:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef0, ChannelId0,
 1572: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1573:     receive
 1574: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef0,
 1575:          {data, ChannelId0, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1576: 	    ok
 1577:     after 5000 ->
 1578: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1579:     end,
 1580: 
 1581:     case ssh_test_lib:daemon(Port, [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1582:                                     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1583:                                     {password, "potatis"},
 1584:                                     {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]) of
 1585: 	{Pid1, Host, Port} ->
 1586: 	    ConnectionRef1 =
 1587:                 ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1588:                                                   {user, "foo"},
 1589:                                                   {password, "potatis"},
 1590:                                                   {user_interaction, true},
 1591:                                                   {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1592: 	    {error, _} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1593:                                                   {save_accepted_host, false},
 1594:                                                   {user, "foo"},
 1595:                                                   {password, "morot"},
 1596:                                                   {user_interaction, true},
 1597:                                                   {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1598: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef0),
 1599: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef1),
 1600: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid0),
 1601: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid1);
 1602: 	Error ->
 1603: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef0),
 1604: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid0),
 1605: 	    ct:fail({unexpected, Error})
 1606:     end.
 1607: 
 1608: no_sensitive_leak(Config) ->
 1609:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1610:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1611:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1612:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1613: 
 1614:     %% Save old, and set new log level:
 1615:     #{level := Level} = logger:get_primary_config(),
 1616:     logger:set_primary_config(level, info),
 1617:     %% Define a collect fun:
 1618:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1619:     Collect = 
 1620:         fun G(N,Nf,Nt) ->
 1621:                 receive
 1622:                     {Ref, false, _} ->
 1623:                         G(N+1, Nf+1, Nt);
 1624:                     {Ref, true, R} ->
 1625:                         ct:log("Report leaked:~n~p", [R]),
 1626:                         G(N+1, Nf, Nt+1)
 1627:                 after 100 ->
 1628:                         {N, Nf, Nt}
 1629:                 end
 1630:         end,
 1631:  
 1632:     %% Install the test handler:
 1633:     Hname = no_sensitive_leak,
 1634:     ok = ssh_log_h:add_fun(Hname,
 1635:                            fun(#{msg := {report,#{report := Rep}}}, Pid) ->
 1636:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid, status) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1637:                                    Pid ! {Ref,ssh_log_h:sensitive_in_opt(Rep),Rep};
 1638:                               (_,Pid) ->
 1639:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid, status) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1640:                                    ok
 1641:                            end,
 1642:                            self()),
 1643: 
 1644:     {_Pid0, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1645: 					      {user_dir, UserDir},
 1646: 					      {password, "morot"},
 1647: 					      {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1648: 
 1649:     _ConnectionRef0 = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1650: 						       {user, "foo"},
 1651: 						       {password, "morot"},
 1652: 						       {user_interaction, true},
 1653: 						       {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1654:     %% Kill acceptor to make it restart:
 1655:     [true|_] =
 1656:         [exit(Pacc,kill) || {{ssh_system_sup,_},P1,supervisor,_} <- supervisor:which_children(sshd_sup),
 1657:                             {{ssh_acceptor_sup,_},P2,supervisor,_} <- supervisor:which_children(P1),
 1658:                             {{ssh_acceptor_sup,_},Pacc,worker,_} <- supervisor:which_children(P2)],
 1659:     
 1660:     %% Remove the test handler and reset the logger level:
 1661:     timer:sleep(500),
 1662:     logger:remove_handler(Hname),
 1663:     logger:set_primary_config(Level),
 1664: 
 1665:     case Collect(0, 0, 0) of
 1666:         {0, 0,   0} -> ct:fail("Logging failed, line = ~p", [?LINE]);
 1667:         {_, _,   0} -> ok;
 1668:         {_, _, Nt0} -> ct:fail("Leak in ~p cases!", [Nt0])
 1669:     end.
 1670:     
 1671: start_subsystem_on_closed_channel(Config) ->
 1672:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1673:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1674:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1675:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1676:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1677: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1678: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1679: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n", {ssh_echo_server, [4000000]}}]}]),
 1680: 
 1681:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1682: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1683: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1684: 						      {user_interaction, false},
 1685: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1686: 
 1687: 
 1688:     {ok, ChannelId1} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1689:     ok = ssh_connection:close(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1),
 1690:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, []),
 1691:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "echo_n", 5000),
 1692:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "testing1.\n", 5000),
 1693:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1694: 
 1695:     %% Test that there could be a gap between close and an operation (Bugfix OTP-14939):
 1696:     {ok, ChannelId2} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1697:     ok = ssh_connection:close(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2),
 1698:     timer:sleep(2000),
 1699:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, []),
 1700:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "echo_n", 5000),
 1701:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "testing1.\n", 5000),
 1702:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1703: 
 1704:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1705:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1706: 
 1707: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1708: max_channels_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1709:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1710:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1711:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1712:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1713:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1714: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1715: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1716: 					     {max_channels, 3},
 1717: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n", {ssh_echo_server, [4000000]}}]}
 1718: 					    ]),
 1719: 
 1720:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1721: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1722: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1723: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1724: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1725: 
 1726:     %% Allocate a number of ChannelId:s to play with. (This operation is not
 1727:     %% counted by the max_channel option).
 1728:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1729:     {ok, ChannelId1} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1730:     {ok, ChannelId2} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1731:     {ok, ChannelId3} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1732:     {ok, ChannelId4} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1733:     {ok, ChannelId5} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1734:     {ok, ChannelId6} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1735:     {ok, _ChannelId7} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1736: 
 1737:     %% Now start to open the channels (this is counted my max_channels) to check that
 1738:     %% it gives a failure at right place
 1739: 
 1740:     %%%---- Channel 1(3): shell
 1741:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId0),
 1742:     receive
 1743: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, <<"Eshell",_/binary>>}} ->
 1744: 	    ok
 1745:     after 5000 ->
 1746: 	    ct:fail("CLI Timeout")
 1747:     end,
 1748: 
 1749:     %%%---- Channel 2(3): subsystem "echo_n"
 1750:     success = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "echo_n", infinity),
 1751: 
 1752:     %%%---- Channel 3(3): exec. This closes itself.
 1753:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "testing1.\n", infinity),
 1754:     receive
 1755: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId2, 0, <<"testing1",_/binary>>}} ->
 1756: 	    ok
 1757:     after 5000 ->
 1758: 	    ct:fail("Exec #1 Timeout")
 1759:     end,
 1760: 
 1761:     %%%---- Channel 3(3): subsystem "echo_n" (Note that ChannelId2 should be closed now)
 1762:     ?wait_match(success, ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId3, "echo_n", infinity)),
 1763: 
 1764:     %%%---- Channel 4(3) !: exec  This should fail
 1765:     failure = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId4, "testing2.\n", infinity),
 1766: 
 1767:     %%%---- close the shell (Frees one channel)
 1768:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1769:     
 1770:     %%%---- wait for the subsystem to terminate
 1771:     receive
 1772: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef,{closed,ChannelId0}} -> ok
 1773:     after 5000 ->
 1774: 	    ct:log("Timeout waiting for '{ssh_cm,~p,{closed,~p}}'~n"
 1775: 		   "Message queue:~n~p",
 1776: 		   [ConnectionRef,ChannelId0,erlang:process_info(self(),messages)]),
 1777: 	    ct:fail("exit Timeout",[])
 1778:     end,
 1779: 
 1780:     %%---- Try that we can open one channel instead of the closed one
 1781:     ?wait_match(success, ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId5, "echo_n", infinity)),
 1782: 
 1783:     %%---- But not a fourth one...
 1784:     failure = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId6, "echo_n", infinity),
 1785: 
 1786:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1787:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1788: 
 1789: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1790: %% Internal functions ------------------------------------------------
 1791: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1792: 
 1793: do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef) ->
 1794:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1795:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 1796: 				  "echo testing", infinity),
 1797:     %% receive response to input
 1798:     receive
 1799: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, <<"testing\n">>}} ->
 1800: 	    ok
 1801:     after
 1802: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1803:     end,
 1804: 
 1805:     %% receive close messages
 1806:     receive
 1807: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
 1808: 	    ok
 1809:     after
 1810: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1811:     end,
 1812:     receive
 1813: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
 1814: 	    ok
 1815:     after
 1816: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1817:     end,
 1818:     receive
 1819: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
 1820: 	    ok
 1821:     after
 1822: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1823:     end.
 1824: 
 1825: 
 1826: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1827: flush_msgs() ->
 1828:     flush_msgs([]).
 1829: 
 1830: flush_msgs(Unexpected) ->
 1831:     receive
 1832:         M ->
 1833:             case lists:member(M, Unexpected) of
 1834:                 true ->
 1835:                     ct:fail("Unexpected message found:  ~p", [M]);
 1836:                 _ ->
 1837:                     flush_msgs()
 1838:             end
 1839:     after
 1840:         500 -> ok
 1841:     end.
 1842: 
 1843: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1844: test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 1845:     test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Prohibited.">>, <<"Eshell V">>).
 1846: 
 1847: test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, NotExpect) ->
 1848:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1849:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef, ChannelId),
 1850:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 1851:     NotExpSz = size(NotExpect),
 1852:     receive
 1853:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 1, <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 1854:             flush_msgs();
 1855: 
 1856:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, <<NotExpect:NotExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 1857:             ct:fail("Could start disabled shell!");
 1858: 
 1859:         R ->
 1860:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 1861:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, '0|1', Expect}} ]),
 1862:             ct:fail("Strange shell response")
 1863: 
 1864:     after 5000 ->
 1865:             ct:fail("Shell Timeout")
 1866:     end.
 1867: 
 1868: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1869: test_exec_is_disabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 1870:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1871:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, "1+2.", infinity),
 1872:     receive
 1873:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,1,<<"Prohibited.">>}} ->
 1874:             flush_msgs();
 1875:         R ->
 1876:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 1877:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,1,<<"Prohibited.">>}} ]),
 1878:             ct:fail("Could exec erlang term although non-erlang shell")
 1879:     after 5000 ->
 1880:             ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1881:     end.
 1882: 
 1883: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1884: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 1885:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Eshell V">>).
 1886: 
 1887: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect) ->
 1888:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, []).
 1889: 
 1890: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, PtyOpts) ->
 1891:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1892:     case PtyOpts of
 1893:         [] ->
 1894:             no_alloc;
 1895:         _ ->
 1896:             success = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, PtyOpts)
 1897:     end,
 1898:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId),
 1899: 
 1900:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 1901:     receive
 1902: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 1903: 	    flush_msgs();
 1904: 
 1905:         R ->
 1906:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 1907:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Expect}} ]),
 1908:             ct:fail("Strange shell response")
 1909: 
 1910:     after 5000 ->
 1911: 	    ct:fail("CLI Timeout")
 1912:     end.
 1913: 
 1914: 
 1915: test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 1916:     test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, "1+2.", <<"3">>).
 1917: 
 1918: test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Exec, Expect) ->
 1919:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1920:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Exec, infinity),
 1921:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 1922:     receive
 1923:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} = R ->
 1924:             ct:log("~p:~p Got expected ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,R]);
 1925:         Other ->
 1926:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 1927:                    [?MODULE,?LINE, Other, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Expect}} ])
 1928:     after 5000 ->
 1929:             {fail,"Exec Timeout"}
 1930:     end.
 1931: 
 1932: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1933: big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId) ->
 1934:     big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, []).
 1935: 
 1936: big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Acc) ->
 1937:     receive
 1938: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Data}} ->
 1939: 	    %% ssh_connection:adjust_window(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, size(Data)),
 1940: 	    %% window was pre-adjusted, don't adjust again here
 1941: 	    big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, [Data | Acc]);
 1942: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId}} ->
 1943: 	    {ok, iolist_to_binary(lists:reverse(Acc))}
 1944:     after ?EXEC_TIMEOUT ->
 1945: 	    timeout
 1946:     end.
 1947: 
 1948: collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize) ->
 1949:     ct:log("~p:~p Listener ~p running! ConnectionRef=~p, ChannelId=~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,self(),ConnectionRef,ChannelId]),
 1950:     collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, [], 0).
 1951: 
 1952: collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum) ->
 1953:     TO = 5000,
 1954:     receive
 1955: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Data}} when is_binary(Data) ->
 1956: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p bytes. total ~p bytes,  want ~p more",
 1957: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,size(Data),Sum+size(Data),EchoSize-Sum]),
 1958: 	    ssh_connection:adjust_window(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, size(Data)),
 1959: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, [Data | Acc], Sum+size(Data));
 1960: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, Msg={eof, ChannelId}} ->
 1961: 	    collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize);
 1962: 
 1963: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, Msg={closed,ChannelId}} ->
 1964: 	    collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize);
 1965: 
 1966: 	Msg ->
 1967: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: ***** unexpected message *****~n~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
 1968: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum)
 1969: 
 1970:     after TO ->
 1971: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: ----- Nothing received for ~p seconds -----~n",[?MODULE,?LINE,TO]),
 1972: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum)
 1973:     end.
 1974: 
 1975: collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize) ->
 1976:     try
 1977: 	iolist_to_binary(lists:reverse(Acc))
 1978:     of
 1979: 	Bin ->
 1980: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p.~nGot in total ~p bytes,  want ~p more",
 1981: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,Msg,size(Bin),EchoSize,size(Bin)]),
 1982: 	    Bin
 1983:     catch
 1984: 	C:E ->
 1985: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p.~nAcc is strange...~nException=~p:~p~nAcc=~p",
 1986: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,Msg,C,E,Acc]),
 1987: 	    {error,{C,E}}
 1988:     end.
 1989: 
 1990: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------
 1991: %% This is taken from the ssh example code.
 1992: start_our_shell(_User, _Peer) ->
 1993:     spawn(fun() ->
 1994: 		  io:format("Enter command\n")
 1995: 		  %% Don't actually loop, just exit
 1996:           end).
 1997: 
 1998: start_our_shell2(_User, _Peer) ->
 1999:     spawn(fun() ->
 2000:                   io:format("Enter command\n"),
 2001:                   read_write_loop1("> ", 1)
 2002:           end).
 2003: 
 2004: ssh_exec_echo(Cmd) ->
 2005:     spawn(fun() ->
 2006:                   io:format("echo ~s\n", [Cmd])
 2007:           end).
 2008: 
 2009: ssh_exec_echo(Cmd, User) ->
 2010:     spawn(fun() ->
 2011:                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
 2012:           end).
